result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristy A Syed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/15/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/15/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  
-Court ordered defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring by Day Reporting Center for work, AODA, hospital visits and mental health visits.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristy A Syed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's pro se letter regarding DRC privileges.

Defendant Kristy A Syed in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  
-Court ordered defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring by Day Reporting Center for work, AODA, hospital visits and mental health visits.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/15/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/15/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.


Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Branch 17 in jury trial.  Case spun to Branch 15.

15RM045186  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10/02/2015
All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Kristy A Syed in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Jazmynn Montanez.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for Sentencing  on October 15, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 17.

Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.   

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, uncharged bail jumping from 9-25-2015 will be read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-15-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Court vacated jury tiral on 9-30-2015.

FILED:
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Kristy A Syed in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Defendant requesting to hire a new attorney. Court held colloquey with defandant and will not allow for change of attorney. Case passed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated September 17, 2015 received and filed. tk

Court orders defendant REFERRAL to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kristy A Syed not in court, in custody. Brandon Wigley on behalf of Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury trial remains scheduled for 09-30-2015 at 9:00 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 27, 2020 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kristy A Syed in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense request for a projected guilty plea date is granted by the court.  Defendant is reminded by the court that all conditions of bail remain in effect.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 17  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kristy A Syed in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT MISSING COURT FILE.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jeremy Fadness-Franklin Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kristy A Syed in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
